As a result of this, she has one beautiful young lady as her apprentice; she is training her for her future career. Training was organized for her so that she can use the loan to achieve her business goal to increase efficiency and profitability. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Mpeasem’, which simply means I don’t want trouble.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products like weavings, mesh, thread, needle etc.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is 50 years old. She is a married woman and has sons and daughters. Some of them are in senior high school and others are in junior high school. Comfort lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.
She is a trader. She deals in all sorts of vegetables such as cabbage, lettuce, carrots, onions, etc. Comfort procures her vegetables from farms in the nearby communities. She sells on a tabletop in the market square. She says she distributes some of her goods to retailers and restaurant operators. Comfort has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure the vegetables in bulk. She is hoping to improve her standard of living and give her children the support they need to further their education.

loans.use: To procure vegetables

loans.name: Sountou

texts.fr: Sountou Baldé est une femme de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle tient un petit étal de commerce de légumes et divers produits alimentaires. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt renforcer cette activité et avec les revenus générés assurer la dépense quotidienne à sa famille.
texts.en:
Sountou Baldé is a 39-year-old woman who is married and has three children. She has a small stall selling vegetables and various grocery items. She would like to use this loan to bolster her. With the revenues generated, she ensures that day-to-day family expenses are covered.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell vegetables and grocery items from her stall

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina A. is 27 years old. She is single with no children. She is single because she has not met the right person yet. Faustina lives with her mother and other siblings in their family house at Cape Coast. She has been a food vendor for a year now. She sells ‘ampesi’ and rice with stew, etc. Ampesi is cooked and enjoyed with any kind of stew. Faustina says the demand for her food has expanded, making it difficult to meet the demands of her customers. Faustina wants the loan to buy more bags of raw materials like rice, meat, and charcoal among others. She is convinced that the loan will help her increase her stock and in the event of a price hike, she would be better prepared to cook food. She says she would be grateful for your assistance. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Amen’.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like yam, plantain, bags of rice, meat, fish, spices and charcoal etc

loans.name: Yaw

texts.en:
Yaw A. is 32 years old. He is single and lives independently. Yaw says he is not married yet because he is not fully prepared to. He lives alone in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana. 
Yaw is a trader. He trades in all kinds of footwear for women. He sells full shoes, half shoes, slippers, etc. He procures the goods from the wholesalers in the regional capital, Cape Coast. He sells his products in a shop in the market square. He says he also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Yaw has been in business for 13 years and wants a loan to procure footwear in bulk to increase his profit margin.

loans.use: To procure footwear in bulk

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama Q. is a 40-year-old woman. She is married with five children who are currently in school. She lives with her family at Cape Coast in the central region of Ghana. She is a food vendor and sells banku. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. She has many customers since it is enjoyed by many Ghanaian as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her income to support her children’s education. She has been in business for five years now. She belongs to the village called ‘Amen’.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet B. is 60 years old. She is a married mother of five children. She says all five children are out of school and working. Janet lives with some of her grandchildren and husband in a family house in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.
Janet is a trader. She trades in all kinds of hardware (fittings and fixtures) such as paint, carpenters hammer, nails, roofing sheets, hinges, and padlocks, to mention but a few. 
She procures the goods all the way from Accra. Janet sells in a shop in the market square in her community. She has been in business for 28 years and wants a loan to procure more goods. She is hoping to expand her business.

loans.use: To procure fittings and fixtures

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 36 years old.  She is married and has given birth to two children. Both of her kids are in school. She lives at Cape Coast in the central region of Ghana. She is an achiever and a resourceful woman who serves as a pillar for the family. She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living. 
Theresa trades in foodstuffs like maize, plantains and grocery products. She has been trading for nine years now. She treks to surrounding villages in the Ashanti region to purchase bulk stock of peanuts, plantain and others from the farmers. She retails to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to pick enough stock to make enough profit to support her family. She wants to use part of the profit to support her kids' education. With the loan, she wants to purchase oranges, plantains and other grocery products in bulk to enable her scale up her sales. Theresa belongs to a village bank called ‘Mpaebo Tiefo’, which means ‘Prayer answering God’.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs like maize, peanuts, plantains and grocery products in bulk.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience K. is 27 years old. She is married and the mother of one child who is breastfeeding. She has been sewing for four years now. She is a specialist in female wear. Her skills and designs are of class. She sews various kinds of styles that give her customers a new look, like kids school uniforms, church attire, kaba and slit, wedding dress, funeral clothes etc. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. Through her dedication and hard work, Patience has two apprentices whom she is giving quality training for their future dependency. She hopes to increase her savings to provide her child with a quality education. Patience belongs to a village bank called ‘Sunkwa’, which means ‘Cry for life’.

loans.use: To buy supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.fr:
G. Valentine est née le 14/02/1970 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Valentine est célibataire avec cinq enfants dont quatre scolarisés. Valentine vend du maïs, de la farine de manioc, du haricot, de l'huile de noix de palme, de galettes d'arachide, de charbon de bois, du riz et de savons. Valentine est dans le commerce depuis quinze (15) ans environ mais c'est avec les prêts qu'elle a eu de ALIDé que Valentine a vu son activité grandir. Pour renforcer son activité afin de mieux satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants Valentine sollicite un nouveau prêt auprès de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
G. Valentine was born on February 14, 1970 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is unmarried and has five children, four of whom are in school. She sells corn, cassava flour, beans, palm nut oil, peanut galettes, charcoal, rice, and soap. She has been in this business for about fifteen years. And with the Alidé loans she had, she's seen her business grow. To bolster her business, so as to do better in supporting herself and her children, Valentine is requesting a new loan from Alidé.

ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. ALIDÉ offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, corn, peanuts, and beans, and boxes of soap

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon D. is 37 years old. He is married and has three children. He loves his work. They live in the central region of Ghana with his entire family. He has been a general photographer for the past year now. He also does video shooting. He owns a photography and video shop where his clients pose for their photographs. He also goes to occasions like parties and concerts to take photographs of his clients. He is requesting a loan to buy additional tools and materials like a camera, flash, video camera etc. to expand his operations. He wants to buy a motor bike, which he believes will ease the distances he walks to take pictures. Solomon belongs to a village bank called ‘Adwendaho’,which means ‘Clear mind’.

loans.use: To buy additional tools and materials like a camera, flash, video camera, glass etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth O. is 45 years old. She is married with four children. According to her, one of them has just completed junior high school. The rest are still in basic school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.
She works hard to make some income to support her husband cater for the family. Elizabeth is a trader. She trades in provisions and all kinds of drinks – malt, fan milk, fan ice, etc. She procures the products from the wholesale dealers in the regional capital, Cape Coast, and sells in the community market. Elizabeth says she owns a shop in which she sells her products. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure the provisions and drinks in bulk.

loans.use: To procure provisions and drinks

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer T. is 32 years old. She is married and a mother of one child. Currently, her daughter Afua is in school. She lives with her husband who is a businessman. She was involved in a severe accident when she was going to buy supplies of goods in Accra. Unfortunately her left hand was chopped off. Her insurance claim was reduced and as vulnerable as she was, she could not get a good lawyer to defend her to collect what is due her. Looking at her situation, Jennifer wanted to commit suicide but she did not upon the advice of her religious leaders and other people. Before that, she used to sew dresses and undertake other businesses that demanded the use of both hands. Right now Jennifer cannot sew dresses apart from patching her daughter's dress. Currently she is into the sale of cooking utensils and selling of lace and clothing materials. She sells through hawking, house-to-house selling; she had 10 years experience in sewing until the pathetic incident occurred. Jennifer also travels to the nearby communities to sell during their market days. She is adapting to her new predicament. Jennifer needs money to provide for her child, herself and the family. Therefore, she wants a loan to buy cooking utensils, lace materials, clothing materials etc. With your support, she believes that she would be more prepared to provide for her family and rent a store to sell. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Sunkwa’, which means cry for help.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials like linen, threads, thimbles, cooking utensils, lace materials etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria S. is 54 years old. She is a married woman with five children. Two are in high school, one is dead, and the rest are working. She lives with her family at Twifo Praso in the central region of Ghana. For the past 20 years, Victoria has been baking bread and other pastries and taking care of her household. In spite of the challenges she faces, she bakes sugar bread, wheat bread, cake, meat pie, chips etc and retails them to her customers. She supplies them by herself in the market center to her customers.
Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are shooting up. She is requesting a loan to remain in business. With the loan, she believes she can provide for her family and most especially her children's education. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Mpaebo Tiefo' which means Prayer answering God.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood etc.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa A. is 40 years old. She is married with five children. At the moment, all her children are in school. She is a local manufacturer of palm oil. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits. The palm oil is processed through various stages to obtain the palm oil.  Palm oil is used to prepare many local dishes. Her production is on a small scale due to capital inadequacy to buy machines for the processing. She also sells farm produce like cassava. Cassava contains 100% carbohydrates and can be used in the preparation of starch, cassava dough, and for fufu etc. She has been in this business for six years now and has gotten lots of experience in good human relations. For that reason, demand for her products is high demand. She is requesting a loan to buy more bags of palm nuts fruits, cassava and gallons to store the palm oil. Palm oil is used to prepare most of the Ghanaian local dishes like stem, fried plantains etc. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Adwumapa’, which simply means Good Work.

loans.use: To buy more palm nuts fruits and other food stuffs.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama Konaté est âgée de 41 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente de crème et aussi utiliser une partie du prêt pour essayer le commerce de pâte d’arachide. Elle aimerait avec ses revenus assurer les charges familiales (nourriture, santé, etc..)
texts.en:
Mariama Konaté is 41 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She wants to bolster her business selling cream and also to use part of her loan to try commerce in peanut butter. With her revenues, she would like to ensure coverage of family expenses (food, health, etc.)

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell cream, ice, and peanut butter

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa P. is 53 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. Currently all her children are working. She lives at Twifo Praso in the central region of Ghana with her husband who is a farmer. Yaa says she has a God-given talent to heal the sick, especially those suffering from goiter disease. She once had a goiter by her neck and it was revealed to her to use shear butter with other leaves for treatment. Lo and behold, she did it and the goiter vanished. Yaa decided to carry out research and find out how she can help people with the same problem. Currently Yaa is a specialist in herbal medicine with specialization in goiter. She prepares her medicine with the use of shear butter and special leaves in the bush, which are known, to her alone. Through that she has healed lots of people with the same challenge. Yaa has nine years experience in herbal medicine. She use to sell her products in paper but now she has designed a smaller container in which she packages the herbal medicine. The inscription on the container is Nyame Bekyere which means ‘God will provide’
Based on her performance and the quality of her medicine, lots of people have come to her for treatment. Fortunately those that came and had their healing are doing well. She needs the loan to buy shear butter for production. With your help she believes others will have the treatment and will be happy too. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Amen’.

loans.use: To buy shear butter for processing of herbal medicine

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua A. is 36 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. She lives with her husband and the children. Currently all her children are in school, either junior high or the primary level. She is a local manufacturer of Soaps. She combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil to obtain her soaps. She is not able to produce in large quantities due to a lack of funds. She wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production. She hopes to raise her income to support her children's education. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Adwumapa’, which means Good work.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil etc.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine S. is 52 years old. She is married and has one daughter who is currently married. Augustine lives with her husband and two of her grandchildren. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits etc. in her neighborhood. In addition to that, she also sells grinding stone and coal pot. She started this trade a year ago and has realized the tremendous way her customers buy her goods, especially the coal pot and the grinding stone. She is requesting a loan to make business improvements. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits and grinding stone, coal pot etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her grandchildren in school. Augustine belongs to a village bank called ‘Adwumapa’ which means Good work.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, sugar, bottled mineral water, biscuits, grinding stones, coal pot etc.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience O. is 32 years old and married with four children. Three are schooling and the last born is breastfeeding. She and her husband are a humble couple who want to invest in their children's future by providing them with an education. Patience lives at Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

She sells foodstuffs such as cooking oil, tinned tomatoes, bags of rice, spices, vegetables etc. in the community market. She says these products move very fast and you can easily recover your money quickly. She takes delivery of goods from the surrounding villages and the capital city of Ghana. Patience deals directly with the wholesalers rather than retailers. She has eight years' experience in selling foodstuffs.

She is requesting a loan to buy more goods so that she can help her husband to raise the family. She will buy more bags of rice, cooking oil, tinned tomatoes, flour and margarine and other foodstuffs. Patience belongs to a village bank called ‘Adwumapa’ which means Good work.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like cooking oil, bags of rice, spices and tinned tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Monsieur Adjamon koffi est un jeune homme dynamique qui s’est lancé en 2000 dans le commerce de ciment, il a ouvert  une boutique qu’il a appelé « Ets ADJAMON & FILS », il reçoit des commandes des entrepreneurs et des maçons. Son stock actuel de ciment étant épuisé il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour s’approvisionner avec 12 paquets de ciment. Etant célibataire il arrive à bien gérer ses économies et subvient convenablement à ses propres charges.
texts.en:
Mr. Koffi Adjamon is an energetic young man who began selling cement in the year 2000. He has opened a store he calls « Ets ADJAMON & FILS ». He receives orders from entrepreneurs and masons. His present stock of cement is expended, so he is requesting his first loan from WAGES to purchase 12 packages of cement. Since he is single, he manages to put aside savings and support himself correctly.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cement in order to increase his inventory

loans.name: Marianne

texts.fr:
K. Marianne est née vers 1955 à Toffo dans le Département de l'Atlantique au Sud du Bénin. Marianne est mariée et a quatre enfants avec son mari, tous scolarisés.  Marianne est Sténodactylographe de formation. Cependant, Marianne est restée dans le commerce depuis trente (30) ans; parce que c'est plus rentable. Marianne est dans la distribution de céréales et autres produits alimentaires: maïs, farine de manioc, huile végétal,etc. Marianne est aussi meunière. Marianne a son moulin à maïs chez elle et elle moud les céréales aux habitants de son quartier. Marianne a pu améliorer le niveau de son activité depuis qu'elle a fait son premier prêt à ALIDé. Ayant fini de rembourser ce premier prêt, Marianne veut un nouveau crédit pour renforcer son activité. 
  
 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Marianne K. was born around 1955 in Toffo in the Atlantique province in the south of Bénin. Marianne is married and has four children with her husband, all enrolled in school.

Marianne is a trained stenographer, however, she has spent 30 years in sales because it brings in more money. She sells cereals and other foodstuffs: maize, manioc flour, vegetable oil, etc. She is also a miller; she has her maize mill at her home and she does the milling of cereals for people in her neighborhood.

Marianne has been able to make improvements to her business rsince she got her first loan with ALIDé. Having finished reimbursing that first loan, Marianne would like another loan to bolster he little business.

The significance of ALIDé in the local language of Bénin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor. Bénin is a small West African country next door to Nigeria; the GDP of its inhabitants stands at US$ 1,500. ALIDé offers special loans at 0% interest for very vulnerable persons, and it is in a group which will soon be offering a micro health insurance program for micro-loan beneficiaries.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sacks of maize, jerrycans of vegetable oil, and teeth for her maize mill

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa A. is a 28 year old trader. She is single with three children. She is still searching for her better half. She lives at Twifo Praso in the central region of Ghana. She sells used clothes in the local market of Twifo. With income from her business, Adwoa is supporting all her kids in school.

Selling of used clothing and bed sheets has a very big market share in Ghana as brand new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. She has been in this business for the past two years. She travels to a nearby city called Accra to purchase her stock of goods. Her major business challenge over the years has to do with funds to scale up the business.

She has lots of marketing experience and is very confident that the loan would enable her to achieve remarkable business progress. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes to serve her customers. She hopes to save enough to support her kids' education. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Amen’.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing sacks of mazie, millet, rice and dried beans for re-sale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
She is married with three children who are in school. Two of her children are working while the last born is still breast feeding. Ama T. is a 44 year old trader. She lives with her husband and children in a family house at Twifo Praso. She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidote to minimizing poverty and, for that matter, she is very serious with her business.

She trades in cereals like maize, plantains, and others like cocoyam etc. She started this business four years ago. Ama makes a living through the profits she makes from her output and through this Ama has been very resourceful to her family.

She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of maize, plantains and cocoyam to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. She believes with the loan she can buy more bags of maize grains, plantains and others. She treks to the farming communities to buy her stock of goods. Ama belongs to a village bank called ‘Amen’. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy larger supply of maize, cocoyam and bunches of plantains.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas B. is 43 years old. She is a married woman with four children. Through the support of her husband she is taking care of two children who are pursuing degree programs at the university. The other two are also in school. She lives with her family at Twifo in the central region of Ghana.

For the past seven years until now, Dorcas has been baking bread and other pastries like cake, doughnuts etc. In taking care of her household, and in spite of the challenges she faces, she bakes sugar bread, wheat bread, etc. and retails them to her customers. She says she makes sure her food quality meets her customer’s expectations. Her customers book their order in advance and before they come their order is ready. She also retails to individuals for their morning breakfast through hawking (that is house-to-house selling).

She says the price of commodities is increasing which is making it difficult to buy more raw materials from the market and the daily demand for bread is high. Dorcas needs the loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, margarine, milk and firewood etc. She said your assistance would be much welcome. Dorcas belongs to a group called Amen. With the loan she believes she can save more to support her husband in taking care of the children's educational needs.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood etc.

loans.name: Coumba Woury

texts.fr: Coumba Woury D. a 39 ans,  mariée et a en charge 09 enfants. Elle tient un petit commerce de produits alimentaires sur étal comme sucre, thé, huile, riz et biscuits. Elle voudrait renforcer son capital afin d’assurer un bonne hygiène de vie à sa famille.
texts.en:
Coumba Woury D., 39, is married and responsible for 9 children. She has a little business selling foodstuffs on a table top, for example sugar, tea, rice, and sweet biscuits. She wants to increase her working capital so as to ensure a healthy lifestyle for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of tea, sugar, rice, oil, and sweet biscuits for re-sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To fix up her cafeteria

loans.name: Odette's Group

texts.fr:
A. Odette est née vers 1956 à Bohicon dans le Centre du Bénin. Odette est veuve depuis onze (11) ans; elle a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Depuis plus de vingt (20) ans Odette est dans le commerce de divers: condiments pour la sauce, riz, haricot, liqueurs, boîtes de conserves, pâtes alimentaires, pâte de maïs, charbon de bois, bois de chauffe, etc. Odette a déjà eu un prêt de ALIDé grâce auquel elle a amélioré le niveau de son activité et qu'elle a bien remboursé. Pour renforcer davantage son activité Odette sollicite un deuxième prêt auprès de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
A. Odette was born around 1956 in Bohicon in central Benin. She has been a widow for eleven years and has five children, all schooled. For over twenty years, Odette has been doing commerce in various goods: condiments for making sauces, rice, beans, liqueurs, canned foods, pasta, corn mash, charcoal, firewood, etc. She has had an Alidé loan before, and thanks to it, she's improved her business activity. She has repaid the loan. To bolster her business more, Odette is requesting a second loan from Alidé. ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. ALIDÉ offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, boxes of milk, drums of vegetable oil

loans.name: Abra Enyonam

texts.fr: Cette  dame a pour activité principale le commerce de légumes et de laitue, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2001, elle exerce cette activité près du marché local de Lossossimé  à agbalépédo, elle a déjà obtenu 02 crédits de WAGES qu’elle a bien remboursé. elle veut associé à son activité le commerce de charbons de bois, pour réaliser cela elle sollicite son troisième crédit de WAGES  pour acheter  18 sacs de charbons et des laitues. Elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est frigoriste, elle a 03 enfants
texts.en:
This woman's principal work involves commerce in vegetables and lettuce. She has been in this business since 2001 and works near the local marketplace of Lossossimé in Agbalépédo. She has obtained two WAGES loans before, and she indeed repaid them. With her business, she wants to include commerce in charcoal. In order to realize this, she's requesting her third WAGES loan to buy 18 sacks of charcoal and some lettuce. She is married to a gentleman who is a refrigeration specialist, and she has three children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal, fruit, and vegetables

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en: Master Kwame, as he is popularly called, is 35 years old. He is married, a father of two children, and very hardworking too. Kwame is a dealer in electrical goods like assorted lights, electrical cables, extension plugs, wires, electric lamps, speakers, transistors, screwdrivers, wires, television cords, antennas, etc. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices. He is requesting a loan to enable him to increase his stock of electrical and electronic parts. He hopes to save enough to expand his shop to include refrigerators. He would be very grateful for your support. He has a lot of experience and has been in this business for the past eleven years, widening his market share in his business area. He belongs to a village bank called "Merciful."

loans.use: To increase his stock of electrical appliances

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel A. is 30 years old. He is married with two children. Right now, all his children attend school in the community where he lives. He is so lovely and jovial towards his children. For a living, he services chainsaws. He lives in a forest zone; for this reason, most of the young folks operate chainsaws, cutting down trees. Samuel services the machines for the owners for a fee. He went to train himself in the big city of Kumasi, and after completing his training on how to service chainsaws he quickly rushed to his hometown to do business. Right now, he services all kinds of chainsaw machines, and he has eleven years of experience. But his only problem has to do with funds to buy chainsaw parts, so that when an issue develops he can quickly work on it or fix it. What happens mostly is he has to wait and charge his clients before he can fix the problem. But he wants loan support to buy assorted parts like chains, blades, nuts, etc. With these, he believes he can be more resourceful and finish his work on time. He belongs to a village bank called "Merciful God."

loans.use: To buy assorted parts for servicing chainsaws

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata K. est une femme de 40 ans mariée avec 01 enfant en charge. Elle veut, avec ce prêt renforcer son capital. Son activité consiste à acheter en gros des sacs de manioc pour le revendre en détail. Elle a pour objectif  d’améliorer les conditions de vie familiales.
texts.en:
Fatoumata K., 40, is married and raising one child. She wants to use this loan to bolster her working capital. Her business consists in buying sacks of manioc wholesale and selling the merchandise retail. Her goal is to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of manioc

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. is 36 years old. She is divorced with two children, both of whom are in school. She says she got divorced because her ex-husband doesn’t like work and always asked her for money. Felicia is very hardworking and committed to her work.  

She owns and operates a grocery shop that sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. She deems it a big opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, and boxes of body and hair creams, etc., to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for her children’s education. Felicia has been in this business for 3 years now, and she belongs to a village bank called "St. Andrews."

loans.use: To increase store's inventory by buying more rice and sugar, vegetable oil, cosmetic creams, etc.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama D. est une femme de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt renforcer son activité de commerce de divers produits comme sucre, colas cigarette et thé. Elle pourra ainsi améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mariama D., 42, is married and the mother of 4 children. She hopes to use this loan to bolster her little business selling various products such as sugar, colas, cigarettes, and tea. She will thus be able to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of various items such as sugar, tea, cigarettes, et colas

loans.name: Rafiou Sourou Tako

texts.fr: Monsieur T. est un résident du quartier d’agoè Adougba, il a ouvert en  2005 une boutique qu’il a appelé « Ets RAFIMEX » non loin du marché locale de kégué, dans cette boutique il fait le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, Il s’approvisionne à Lomé . Voulant agrandir son stock pour mieux vendre et réaliser beaucoup de recettes il sollicite de WAGES  son premier  crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter 20 bidons d’huile de 25 l, 12 sacs de riz et divers produits pour son commerce. Il est marié et père d’01 enfant, sa femme est une couturière.
texts.en:
Mr. T. is a resident of Agoè Adougba district. In 2005 he opened a shop that he calls « Ets RAFIMEX », not far from the local market of Kégué. In this shop he sells foodstuffs. He buys his supplies in Lomé. Wishing to expand his inventory so as to make more sales and thus more income, he is requesting his first loan from WAGES. The loan will allow him to buy 20 jerrycans of 25 liters of oil, 12 sacks of rice, and various articles for his business. He is married and the father of one child. His wife is a seamstress.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sacks of rice, soap, and jerrycans of oil

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en:
Kwame A. is forty years old and is divorced for a reason known to him. He has two children with his divorcee wife. Currently all his children are in school. Kwame lives at Twifo Praso in the central region of Ghana.

Kwame has a showcase in which he arranges his watches. He sells chain watches, leather watches, wall clocks and many more. Kwame also offers repair services to people who have a problem with their watches.

Kwame requests a loan to enable him buy gold watches, silver watches, wall clocks and others. With the loan he is convinced that he will be able to provide for his family. He belongs to a village bank called ‘God is Love’.

loans.use: To buy wrist watches and wall clocks

loans.name: Salimatou

texts.fr: Salimatou Mané est une dame de 70 ans, mariée avec 3 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle s’active dans la vente de thé, sucre, huile. En même temps, elle va acheter 4 bœufs, qu’elle va élever un moment avant de les revendre. Ses revenus vont lui permettre de subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Salimatou Mané is a 70-year-old lady, married with 3 children for whom she is responsible. She sells tea, sugar and oil. At the same time, she is going to buy 4 cows that she will raise for a while before re-selling them. Her income allows her to support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of sugar, oil, and tea and raising cattle

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr: Pauline N. est mariée et a en charge 7 enfants. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour promouvoir son activité d’embouche porcine. Elle compte acheter des porcs, les élever et les revendre. Ses revenus vont lui permettre de contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Pauline N. is married and responsible for 7 children. She is requesting this loan to expand her pig-raising business. She wants to buy pigs, raise them, and re-sell them. Her income will allow her to contribute to improving living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing, raising and re-selling pigs

loans.name: Marie Adjo

texts.fr: Cette dame a commencé depuis 2007 le commerce de pagnes, le commerce de pagnes est très rentable à Lomé car beaucoup de personnes surtout les femmes l’utilisent pour confectionner les habits, elle vend ses pagnes dans les marchés environnants de Lomé, voulant mieux satisfaire sa clientèle elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 30 pièces de pagnes. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This lady began in 2007 to sell "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth). The sale of pagnes is very lucrative in Lomé because many people, especially women, use them to make clothing. She sells her pagnes in the markets around Lomé. Wishing to better satisfy her clientele, she is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy 30 lengths of pagne. She is married and the mother of 2 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes"

loans.name: Bélange

texts.fr: Bélange D. est une femme mariée, âgée de 32 ans ayant à sa charge 3 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de tissu teinté « Thioup » et souhaiterait renforcer son commerce afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Bélange D. is a married woman, aged 32, responsible for 3 children. She sells dyed cloth known as "Thioup". She would like to bolster her business so as to be better able to support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of dyed cloth known as "Thioup"

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie T. a 45 ans, mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour s’activer dans la vente de crème et  de glace, très rentable en cette période de chaleur. Elle a pour objectif d’assurer les dépenses nécessaires aux études universitaire de son enfant.
texts.en:
Marie T., 45, is married and the mother of 4 children. She is requesting this loan to sell cream and ice, a lucrative business in this hot weather. Her goal is to ensure that she will have the necessary funds to pay for university studies for her child.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: preparing and selling cream and ice

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie M. est mariée et a 5 enfants en charge. Elle veut maintenir et renforcer son activité de vente de tissu teint « Thioup ». Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie M. is married and responsible for 5 children. She wants to maintain and expand her business selling dyed cloth known as "Thioup". Her goal is to better the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of dyed cloth called "Thioup"

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Mrs. Fely P. is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old and a widow with seven children: three of them are married, two are now working and two are studying. Her life as a widow is full of challenges specially with the finances.

She decided to start a business in 1997 with minimal starting capital. With patience and hard work, she has made it until now. With the help of Paglaum MPC she is able to access additional capital that will enable her to purchase goods in volume at a lower cost. Her customers are the employees of different offices, neighbors, relatives and friends.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics in volume

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Mrs. Elvie S., 40 years of age, is married and lives in Eastern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. With their simple abode near the seashore, she works hard to support her family with buying and selling fish and other seafood. Her husband, who is a fisherman, and all her six children help one another make a living.

Close family ties motivate the couple to survive. They applied to Paglaum for a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 to finance their fishing business.

Elvie desires to send all her children to school with Paglaum MPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: To finance their fishing business

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Mrs. Beverly P. is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old, married with one child who works in a call center. Her husband is a retired sales manager. Starting their married life was not as easy as they thought they could overcome.

Beverly worked at snack vending and later they were able to establish a sari-sari store and successfully provide education for her child. Her passion for business still continues. Later, she encountered Paglaum MPC with whom she can access additional capital, savings and insurance.

The desire of their heart is to open another branch in a nearby locality in order to provide employment for those in need.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mela

texts.en:
Mrs. Mela C. is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, married with 5 children. Two of her children are married already, two are in school and one recently finished college. Her husband is a carpenter and part-time motorcycle driver.

Due to financial difficulties, she decided to open a sari-sari store to help meet their daily basic needs. She started with an initial investment of 5,000 pesos only. A relative told her about the program and services of Paglaum MPC and she decided to become a full-fledged member in March, 2009. Now she is requesting a loan of 5,000 pesos.

She dreams that someday her business will expand and she will have a bigger store made of concrete. She hopes to send their children to school and to have a good standard of living.

loans.use: Additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa G. is busy tending her vegetable stall and snack-vending business in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. At the age of 40 and with two lovely children, her eagerness to provide for her family through selling is amazing.

She sells her snacks and vegetables to people in their neighborhood. Josefa realizes that their main problem, being on their own, is their need for additional capital. That made her decide to reach out to Paglaum MPC for a loan of PHP 20,000.

Josefa hopes some day to own a restaurant and to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: To provide additonal capital for her snack vending and fruits and vegetable stall

location.town: Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is requesting a loan of 14,500 PHP for the purchase of fertilizers for her corn production project. She believes that if this project does not fall victim to bad weather conditions, she will bring in a bountiful harvest as in the past.

Rosalie is a native of Tolon, Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte and married with 2 children. Her husband works as a bus driver and farmer. Aside from corn planting, she also sells fresh fruit and vegetables as a way of earning other income in case her husband can't work. She is on her 6th loan cycle and has maintained her MIGS (Member in Good Standing) status at the Coop by her repayment record and attendance.

She is planning to plant cassava and sweet potato after her corn crop in the near future. She works hard with her husband in hopes that she can send all her children to college and they can have decent homes.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her corn production project

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
With her entrepreneurial skills, Mrs. Lilian D. opened a snack shop and its main delicacy is shakes. She also sells regular soft drinks and bread. Mrs. Lilian D. is 62 years old, married, and lives at Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She has 4 children. Her husband is employed. 

Mrs. D. has the snack shop as her primary business interest and she manages it well. Her main customers are neighbors, students, friends, passersby and members of Paglaum Multi-purpose Cooperative. The cooperative has helped her with financial assistance and other benefits given to members. Now, she is applying for PHP 10,000 to buy ingredients for shake making & soft drinks for her snack shop. She is looking forward to a successful business and hoping she can expand it someday.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for shakes and soft drinks for a snack shop

loans.name: Savina

texts.en:
Mrs. Savina P. ventured into the “sari-sari” (general store) business in order to help her husband. She is married and lives in Tawi-tawi, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She has 5 children. Her husband is a laborer.

Mrs. P. got additional working capital from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in November, 2008. She is a Member in Good Standing of the Cooperative. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC because she has been able to continue her business and send her children to school. Today, she is applying for 10,000 PHP to buy additional goods for her store. In the future, she wants to see all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for "sari-sari" store

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth L. lives in the town of Usocan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old, married and has seven children. Her husband works abroad as a construction worker.

The family has had some difficulties meeting their needs. It is very hard for Mrs. L. to budget their small income given the rising prices of basic commodities. She must have another source of income to supplement her husband's earnings.

Last 2007, she decided to join the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to take advantage of its loan facilities and benefits. She was able to start her sari-sari store business. Her customers are her neighbors. Now, she is applying for 15,000 PHP to buy additional inventory for her sari-sari store.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Mrs. Elvie D. is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old, married with two children aged 8 and 5. Her husband is a chainsaw operator.

Her husband’s earnings are not enough, especially as the children grow older. She had no capital to start a business, so she found a way - a friend told her about Paglaum MPC giving financial assistance to those who need it. She became a member, obtained a loan, and started a sari-sari store. Now, she helps to augment their household income.

Hard work, patience, and determination is the only thing they have, believing then that they can send their children to college where they can obtain a degree and have a decent life in the future.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Mrs. Elvie M. is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old and married with 2 children, ages 14  and 10, both of whom are in school. Her husband's income as a carpenter is not enough to support the family, especially when the children approach college age. With no capital to start a business on her own, she applied for membership to Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and received a loan to start a business in selling ready-to-wear (RTW) clothes to neighbors and friends on a monthly installment basis.  Hard work and determination are the only things Elvie and her husband have, but they believe they will enable them to send their children to college and live comfortable lives.

loans.use: To purchase more ready-to-wear (RTW) clothes for sale

loans.name: Jessrell

texts.en:
Jessrell R. is a native of Dapacan Alto, Calamba, and a member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative.  Jessrell is happily married to Rolando who also hails from Calamba.  They were blessed with two children, both of whom are still in elementary school.

Jessrell is now on her second loan cycle, using the PHP5,000 loaned to her to purchase feeds, vitamins, and other related materials for her piggery/hog fattening project.  Her goal is to increase her income so she can buy 10 hogs. Jessrell hopes to maintain or improve her project so she will have enough income to support her family and ultimately help all her children become professionals someday.

loans.use: Purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen T. is a 46-year-old mother of four. Her husband, Cyrus, is a barangay (local district) councilor. Helen was a dealer for Avon cosmetics company for 15 years until she became a unit manager for the company. With her income from Avon, she has been able to send her four children to college.

Helen has applied for this loan in order to support some of her Avon dealers. In the past she has made payments for some of her dealers in order to take advantage of a bigger discount. She also buys stock in bulk in order to make more profit. In the future, Helen wants to be able to make her house more secure and comfortable.

loans.use: To finance her cosmetics sales

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en: Sheryl V. is a 28 year-old mother married to John, who is a rickshaw driver. The couple wants to establish their living before having a baby. She applied for this loan to finance the down payment on a motorcycle she wants to get, and to buy a sidecar for it. The new tricycle they want will be for rent, since her husband is presently driving their own unit. She hopes that they can cope with the monthly installments and save money to build a better house, for she wants to establish a stable family with her kids in the future.

loans.use: To finance a motorcycle

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
A medium-size wooden house located in Phnom Penh and a workshop belong to Mrs. Meas L.. She, age 49, has been running a business for years as a used-goods seller. She normally buys the recycled goods to store in her home, and then sells them to gain income.

She is married with two children who are students; one of them works as a motor taxi driver to provide income to support his studies. Her husband is a staff member of a train station.

She would like a $1000 loan to purchase a truck for her business. She will use the truck to transport more used goods.

loans.use: To purchase a truck for her used-goods business

loans.name: Siapai

texts.en: Siapai T., 34, is married with three children. This is her first loan with Kiva partner, SPBD, and she is requesting funds for a food stall business. Although she has no previous experience, she will be selling to the public seven days a week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (WST). SPBD loans are Siapai’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase boxes of mutton flaps, sacks of flour, sacks of onions and a gas stove

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Sang S. is 56 years old. She makes a living growing morning glories at the public lakes in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. By selling her flowers each month, she earns $5 per day to cover her family's needs. Her husband works with her in the business. They have six children; five of them are married and live independently, while one still lives in the family home. S. is requesting a loan to support her business operations. She will use the money to purchase seeds, fertilizer, pumps and insecticide to grow morning glories.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, pumps and insecticide to grow morning glories.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa S., 56, is married with six children.  She has five years of experience in the shop business. She sells to the general public, seven days per week. She has had five previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 750 Tala (~260 USD).  SPBD loans are Rosa’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of flour, sugar and rice and boxes of noodles

loans.name: Afiafi

texts.en:
Afiafi S., 40, is married with seven children. She has two years of experience in the ice cake business. She sells to the general public seven days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 750 Tala (approximately 260 USD).

Afiafi has two previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Afiafi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a sack of sugar, a freezer, coolers and plastic bags to make ice cakes

loans.name: Malaea

texts.en: Malaea M., 64, is married with four children.  She has four years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the general public, seven days per week. She has had four previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 750 Tala (~260 USD).  SPBD loans are Malaea’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase an electric sewing machine, materials, and needles

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура женщина 23 лет, замужем , имеет  двоих детей.Она с мужем занимается откормом и продажей скота.Кроме этого её муж работает разнорабочим.Манзура очень любит ухаживать за скотом.У неё маленькие дети, и поэтому она не имеет возможности , работать.Но она помогает мужу по уходу за скотом.Она также доит коров продаёт молоко.Манзура решила помочь мужу расширить бизнес мужа, получив кредит.Для чего и обратилась в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Manzura is 23 years old, married and has two children. She and her husband run a business of raising and selling cattle. Besides this her husband also does odd jobs. Manzura loves to take care of the cattle very much. She has small children and does not have an ability to work somewhere. So she is helping her husband with the cattle. She also milks the cows and sells the milk. Manzura decided to help her husband to expand the business by taking out a loan. She has come to MicorInvest for this reason.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en:
Nhem S. is 44 years old and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She earns a daily income of $8 selling fresh fish and pork in the city’s garment district. She started her business in early 2000. She is a good mother who cares for four children, two of whom are employed as a security guard and a garment worker.

To help support the family, S.'s husband (also pictured) drives a motorbike taxi. The family has faced difficult living conditions for a long time because their house is old and frequently needs repairs. S. is requesting a loan of $800. She will use half of the money to repair her house and the rest to expand her business.

loans.use: To repair her house and expand her business.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa E. is a 53-year-old member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative from Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur, industriously caring for her food-vending activities while her husband is busy farming.  She is married and has one child.  Celsa personally takes charge of their business. The business is doing well.  Celsa has humbly taught her child the techniques of how to enjoy business and at the same time make earnings from it. The ups and downs of the business are nothing but a normal situation for her. Sometimes they have business losses, sometimes a good return. She is a savvy businesswoman. 

Now Celsa sees a good opportunity to expand their business. She is requesting PHP 5,000 from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for capital to buy additional ingredients. She deeply wishes for a good education for her kid and for them to own a motorcycle for deliveries.

Celsa is shown in the photo together with her helper making polvoron -- a popular delicacy made from powdered milk, flour and sugar.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Mahbuda

texts.ru:
Махбуда , женщина сорока лет , проживает в районе Утконсой вблизи гор.Она нигде не работает , а занимается откормом и продаже скота и домашнего молока.Продаёт скот её муж, т.к. продажа скота , это мужская работа.Махбуда решила помочь мужу , увеличить в кредит его оборотный капитал,при помощи кредита.
Сейчас у неё пять больших коров , которые дают в день 20 литров молока.На деньги кредита она хочет купить ещё пару голов скота.
texts.en:
Mahbuda is a 40 year old woman and lives in the Utkansoi area close to the mountains. She does not have a job and fattens and sells livestock and home produced milk. Her husband sells the livestock since livestock sales is a man’s job. Mahbuda decided to help her husband - increase his working capital with the help of a loan. Right now she owns five large cows which produce 20 liters of milk per day. She would like to use the loan money to purchase a couple more heads of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fatten and sells livestock

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine D. is a 24 year-old mother of two. Her husband is a motorcycle driver. She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) to get capital to help support the needs of the family. Her first loan was used to buy a pig for fattening, and she is applying for this loan to buy a cow and another pig to expand her piggery. She hopes to grow her business for the education of her two children. The opportunity to get loans from ASHI has impacted her life and her family as well.

loans.use: To buy one cow and one pig

loans.name: Salevao

texts.en: Salevao P., 34, is married with 4 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the vegetable gardening business. She sells to the general public 7 days per week. She has had 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~250 USD).  SPBD loans are Salevao’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase ferterlizer, seeds, hose, and chemicals

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia P. is 59 years old with 4 children.  She is married to a farmer and they work together for a good living.  From Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur, she and her husband manage their selling business, which they started from a small capital.  Virginia personally handless the store where their potential customers are their neighbors.  Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing. 

She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to Php 9,000.00 for the purchase of additional inventories to sell.  As much as possible, they have to have all the needed stocks for a good income. In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales.  She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well

loans.use: Expansion

loans.name: Barchin

texts.ru: Барчин женщина сорока лет , за мужем , имеет шестерых детей.Муж работает на стройке бригадиром.Кроме своей работы он вместе с женой занимается откормом и продажей скота.Сама Барчин занимается вязанием зимних носков и козьей шерсти.У неё свои постоянные клиенты по закупу её носков.Барчин хочет увеличить скот в кредит.Их скот целыми днями посётся на пастбищах вблизи гор.Сейчас сезон дешёвого скота, поэтому она обратилась в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Barchin is a 40 year old woman, she is married and she has six children. Her husband works as a foreman at a construction site. In addition to his job he fattens and sells livestock together with his wife. Barchin herself knits winter socks from goat wool. She has regular customers that purchase her socks. Barchin would like to increase her livestock count with the help of a loan. Their livestock goes out to pasture all day at the pastures near the mountains. Right now livestock is cheap and this is why she has turned to MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock

loans.name: Lemalie

texts.en: Lemalie V., 35, is married with 6 children.  She has 1 year of experience in the food stall business. She sells to the general public 7 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~250 USD).  SPBD loans are Lemalie’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase pots, sack of taros, bunch of bananas, chemical weeds

loans.name: Selina

texts.en: Selina P., 25, is single with no children.  She has little experience in the BBQ & school canteen business. She sells to the general public 5 days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 800 Tala (~333 USD).  SPBD loans are Selina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks

loans.use: Purchase box of mutton flaps, box of drumsticks, bananas, box of sausages

loans.name: Kizimat

texts.ru: Кизимат мужчина 41 года , женат имеет двоих детей. Проживает Кизимат в при горном посёлке Кичик Айри , района Уткансой. В их районе все семьи занимаются откормом и продажей скота. Также и Кизимат имеет основной доход на проживание благодаря бизнесу животноводства. Он сам имеет большой земельный участок , где посеял арахис. Земледелием он занимается с молоду, поэтому имеет постоянных оптовых клиентов. На деньги получившие в Микроинвест Кизимат хочет закупить скот, увеличить оборотный капитал. Сейчас у него имеется три коровы и десяток коз.
texts.en:
Kizimat is a 41 year old man, he is married and has two children. Kizimat lives in a mountain village called Kichik Ayri in the Utkansoi area. In their area all the families feed and sell livestock. Kizimat’s main source of income is the livestock business. He owns a large plot of land where he has planted peanuts. He has worked in agriculture since he was a youth and as a result he has regular wholesale customers. Kizimat plans to use the money that he will receive from MicroInvest to purchase livestock and increase his working capital. Right now he owns three cows and ten goats.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Moana

texts.en: Moana S., 35, is married with 4 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public 6 days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~250 USD).  SPBD loans are Moana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase chemical weeds, bush knives, filling knives

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalie M. is a 32-year-old woman from Buenavista, Pagadian City. She is married with 2 kids. Her husband works abroad.  Having started her sari-sari (variety) store business from a meagre capital, she coped well with the challenges of her business.  The small business is doing so well that she has confidently decided to expand. 

She has joined Paglaum MPC for the chance to avail herself of loans. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 14,900 to additionally capitalize her business.  She is determined to maintain a good credit standing whatever may happen, so she can always go to the cooperative in the future.  She envisions acquiring an additional market stall. She dreams also of renovating their little house and to start saving now for the education of their children

loans.use: Expansion for rice retailer of 5 sacks

loans.name: Mkerita

texts.en:
Makerita T., 30, is married with three children. She has two years of experience in the BBQ business. She sells to the general public six days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (approximately 210 USD).

Makerita has no previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Makerita’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a box of mutton flaps, a box of dumsticks, bananas and a box of sausages for her BBQ business

loans.name: Nurjon

texts.ru: Нурчон  молодой человек 23 лет, не женат. Проживает в районе Уткансой. Живёт он вместе с родителями. С детства он помогал по уходу за скотом своему отцу, а теперь занимается самостоятельно. В прошлом году он был на заработках в России. Но с наступлением кризиса, его сократили с работы. Приехав домой , он начал свой давнишний бизнес, куплю и продажу скота. Также, он приехав в город работает разнорабочим. Друзья Нурчона посоветовали ему в кредит увеличить скот, пока он дешёвый на рынке. Для чего Нурчон и обратился в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Nurjon is a young 23 year old man, he is not married. Nurjon lives in the Utkansoi region. He lives with his parents. Since childhood he has helped his father tend the livestock and now he does this by himself. Last year he was a migrant worker in Russia, but with the start of the crisis he was laid off. After returning home he started his old business – the purchase and sale of livestock. Also, he goes to the city and works as a laborer. Nurjon’s friends suggested that he take out a loan to increase his livestock count, while the livestock is cheap at the market. This is why he has turned to MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mrs. Mary Grace A., 21 years old, is married with 1 kid.  She lives in Balangasan District, Pagadian City.  Her husband is a painter.  The couple could not obtain a high paying job so they decided to venture into sari-sari (variety) store business, but there was no capital at hand.  With determination and courage they applied for membership at Paglaum MPC, having heard of its loan windows.  In her desire to help her husband, she applied for Php 14,900 from the cooperative.  Their neighbors became their customers, and eventually they could even display their products in the public market. 

The small business is going so well that she decided to expand. Mrs. A. has been able to pay her previous loan in a timely fashion, and is a member in good standing.  She has high hopes that God will bless their business, and that they will hopefully own a bigger store when their profits allow.  In the future, she wants to see her child finish good education.

loans.use: Purchase additional stocks for her variety store

location.town: Balangasan District, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Neta

texts.en:
Neta A., 26, is married with one child. She doesn’t have any years of experience in the school canteen business. She sells to the school canteen five days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (approximately 210 USD).

Neta has no previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Neta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a box of mutton flaps, a box of dumsticks, bananas and a box of sausages for her business

loans.name: Ivoga

texts.en: Ivoga P. S., 23, is married with one child.  She has just started in the food production business. She sells to the general public, seven days per week. She has not had any previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~210 USD).  SPBD loans are Ivoga’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of flour and sugar, barrels of oil, and pots

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en: Mrs. Jenelyn D.  is 22 years old, married and a resident of Balangasan District, Pagadian City.  Her husband is a cook. Because it is hard for them to survive if only her husband is working, she decided to engage herself in selling.  She started a sari-sari (mini- grocery) store with a small capital. Their primary customers are their neighbors. Successfully, she was able to manage it well, and able to finance the daily needs of her family with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. She was able to avail herself of two loans and paid them religiously. Now, she applies for a loan of PHP 6,000 to finance the additional stocks to purchase for her sari-sari store. She is looking forward to expanding her sari-sari into a Mini-mart someday.

loans.use: Expansion of her mini-grocery business

location.town: Balangasan District, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Suitupe

texts.en: Suitupe F., 38, is married with four children.  She has two years of experience in the vegetable garden business. She sells to the general public, seven days per week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 850 Tala (~300 USD).  SPBD loans are Suitupe’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a hose, sacks of fertilizer, tomato and cabbage seeds

loans.name: Falefono

texts.en: Falefono F., 34, is married with one child. She has two years of experience in the ice cake business. She sells to the general public seven days a week. Her goal in obtaining this loan was to purchase a sack of sugar, a freezer, coolers, and plastic bags. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 700 Tala (about $291). SPBD loans are Falefono’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks, and this is her third SPBD loan.

loans.use: To purchase a sack of sugar, a freezer, coolers, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Jocelyn D. M. is 41 years old, married and lives at Balintawak, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Sur, Philippines. In order to earn a living she takes in opening a sari-sari (variety) store. Her husband is a truckman and they have 5 children to feed, she works hard to have a good life.  

Through Pauglam PC she obtained the capital to start up the business. Now, she requests a loan of PHP 14,900 to buy additional inventories. She really hopes & prays that her business would grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete store.

loans.use: Expansion of her variety store

loans.name: Faapo

texts.en: Faapo K., 33, is married with two children. She has three years of experience in the general store business and sells to the general public seven days per week. She requested this loan in order to purchase mutton flaps, Drumsticks, Twisties, tinned fish, and a freezer. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 1000 Tala (about $416). SPBD loans are Faapo’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. This is her first SPBD loan.

loans.use: To purchase mutton flaps, Drumsticks, Twisties, tinned fish, and a freezer.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Шухрат мужчина 32 лет , женат имеет четверых детей. Работает в колхозе дехканином. Кроме работы в колхозе, он занимается откормом и продажей скота. Его бизнес заключается в купле скота, его откорма и продажи с наценкой. С бизнеса животноводства Шухрат продвигает свою семейную жизнь. Его жена помогает ему в его отсутствии, по уходу за скотом. Она также занимается продажей козьей пряжи. Для закупа скота Шухрат решил получить кредит.
texts.en:
Shuhrat is a man of 32 years of age, married and has four children. He is a land owner in a collective farm. Besides this job he also raises and sells cattle. His business consists of buying cattle, feeding it for growth and reselling it with a profit. This animal husbandry business improves his family's livelihood. His wife helps with the cattle when Shuhrat is absent. She also sells goat yarn. Shuhrat decided to apply for a loan to buy cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cattle

loans.name: Bou

texts.en:
Mrs. Bou T., 46, owns a few looms in her home for braiding silk. She usually braids traditional skirts and scarves for sale. Her clients order her products a few days or a week before she begins braiding them. To make more products, her six children assist with her business activities when they are not studying.

She is married to Mr. Hoeun, 47, who invests as a rice cultivator. T. thinks her husband's business is profitable for the family. She would like a $1000 loan in order to buy a cultivating machine. They will use it to plow a field and to make other income by renting it to the farmers. The family lives in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a cultivating machine

loans.name: Pefa

texts.en: Pefa A. C. has two years of experience in the plantation business and sells to the general public six days per week. Her loan was requested to purchase weed chemicals, bush knives, and filling knives. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 800 Tala (about $333). SPBD loans are Pefa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks, and this is her third SPBD loan. She is 40 years old and married with 12 children.

loans.use: To purchase weed chemicals, bush knives, and filling knives.

loans.name: Kalameli

texts.en: Kalameli T., 39, is married with five children.  She has just started in the plantation business. She sells to the general public, six days per week. She has not had any previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 800 Tala (~280 USD).  SPBD loans are Kalameli’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase weed killer, bush knives, and filling knives

loans.name: Domullo

texts.ru: Домулло 39 летний мужчина, женат, имеет троих детей. Жена работает учительницей в средней школе. Домулло 12 лет работал инспектором в ГАИ, но в связи с ухудшением здоровья он вышел на пенсию. Его пенсия не хватает на жизнь, поэтому он решил заняться бизнесом откорм и продажи скота. Этим бизнесом он занимался и раньше, но теперь он полностью отводит время на скот. Его здоровье на много улучшилось и он вполне готов продолжать свою работу. Для увеличения оборотного капитала, он решил взять кредит. На снимке его жена, сам Домулло отсутствовал во время мониторинга.
texts.en:
Domullo is a 39 year old man, he is married and has three children. His wife works as a teacher in a secondary school. Domullo has been working as a traffic cop for twelve years, but has retired early due to worsened health. His pension is not enough to cover life expenses and this is why he decided to start a business by raising and reselling cattle. He is familiar with this business and has done it before, but now he is fully devoting his time to cattle. His health has improved a great deal and he is ready to continue his work. To increase the working capital he decided to get a loan. His wife is pictured here because Domullo himself was not present during the screening session.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cattle

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen T., 57 years old, is married and a resident of Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Her husband is a farmer and they have 3 children. They have been in sari-sari store business for many years already.  Since she wants to be more productive, she has now decided to expand her store.

Carmen and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to avail loan because they wanted to buy additional inventories. But aside from financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings.  She has now applied for a loan of PHP 4,000. She is wishing that with Paglaum’s help, and with patience & diligence of her husband she is looking forward to being successful vendor someday.

loans.use: Expansion of her variety store

loans.name: Sulufaiga

texts.en: Sulufaiga P. is the 53-year-old married mother of five children. She has three years of experience in the craft business and sells to the general public six days per week. She requested this loan to help her business: bowl kava, dree designs, elei, bags, earrings, and handicrafts such as uatogi. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 1,000 Tala (about $416). SPBD loans are Sulufaiga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks, and this is her first SPBD loan.

loans.use: Purchases to help her business: bowl kava, dree designs, elei, bags, earrings, and handicrafts such as uatogi.

loans.name: Lonise

texts.en:
Lonise G., 67, is the widowed mother of eight children. She has five years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the village people and public six days per week. She requested this loan to purchase another sewing machine and material for puletasi. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (about $208). SPBD loans are Lonise’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

She has 10 previous loans with SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase another sewing machine and material for puletasi.

loans.name: Lita
