loans.use: Purchase more items for his store

loans.name: Malik Mariama

texts.fr: Madame M. habite à Adidogomé, un quartier de Lomé, la capitale du Togo avec ses 5 enfants et son mari qui est chauffeur de taxi.  Madame M. a commencé depuis 2004 le commerce d’articles ménagers (seaux en plastique).  Voulant agrandir son stock pour mieux vendre et pour mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, elle sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter plus d’articles ménagers.
texts.en:
Mrs. M. lives in Adidogomé, a district of Lomé, the capital of Togo, with her 5 children and her husband who is a taxi driver. Mrs. M. began in 2004 to sell household goods (plastic buckets). Wishing to expand her inventory so as to make more sales and better satisfy the needs of her clientele, she is requesting her first loan to buy more household goods.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of household goods (plastic buckets)

loans.name: Satan

texts.fr: Satang C. est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle projette de renforcer son commerce de crème et de glace qu’elle fait au niveau des écoles de la localité et de porte à porte. Ses revenus lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Satang C. is married and has 3 children. She plans to develop her ice cream business, which she sells at local schools and door-to-door. Her increased income will allow her to better provide for her family.

Translated from French by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School and door-to-door sale of ice cream

loans.name: Alladin

texts.en: Alladin A. is a 30 year old businessman who sells home improvement accessories such as paints, wallpaper and so on. He started this business two years ago. He is married and has two sons. The products he sells are in high demand among the locals and Alladin is a polite man, which makes his business very successful. Now Alladin would like to expand his business and, for this purpose,  he has applied for a $3000 US loan. He will use the loan to increase his stock.

loans.use: To purchase stock for a home improvements store

loans.name: Diaraye

texts.fr: Diaraye S., 49 ans, est mariée et a 5 enfants en charge. Elle souhaiterait promouvoir son activité de transformation et de vente de pâte d’arachide. Elle compte, avec ses revenus soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Diaraye S. is 49 years old and married with 5 children. She would like to promote her business producing and selling peanut butter. She hopes to support her husband with her income in providing for their family.

Translated from French by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production and sale of peanut butter

loans.name: Khatira

texts.en: Khatira S., the 55-year-old mother of seven children, rents a store where she sells cosmetics, women’s crèmes and underwear. This business, which she has operated for the past two years, earns permanent income and allows her family to live in normal conditions. As this is the family’s only source of income, Khatira does her best to make her business successful, always carrying a wide range of products and maintaining very friendly relationships with her customers. Kahtira is hoping to expand her business with a loan of $1500 to purchase more items for the store.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Raxmon

texts.ru: Рахмон мужчина 39 лет, женат и имеет 4 детей. Работает в колхозе простым рабочим. За работу кроме наличных денег получает продуктами питания, а также во время сезона запасается сеном. Это помогает ему при его занятии дополнительным бизнесом – куплей продажей скота. По выходным он выходит на местные рынки и при возможности покупает там скот по дешевке. Если получится, продает, если нет, то привозит домой и через неделю выводит на следующий базар. Это его дополнительный источник семейного бюджета. Рахмон подал заявку на КИВА и собирается расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Raxmon is a 39-year-old man, married and has four children. He works as a laborer on a collective farm. In addition to cash, he receives food in exchange for his labor. Seasonally he also receives hay in payment that helps him with his second job, which is buying and selling cattle. On weekends he goes out to the local markets and, when possible, buys inexpensive cattle there. If it all works out, he sells them right away, but if not takes them home and tries the next market a week later. This is his additional source of income to support his family. Raxmon applied to Kiva for a loan and is planning to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Isabelle

texts.fr:
JOHNSON Isabelle est âgée de 45 ans et est mariée à TOMETISSIN Claude. Isabelle a avec son mari deux enfants tous scolarisés. Isabelle et sa famille résident à Gbégamey un quartier populaire de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Isabelle a pour activité la vente de céréales et de divers (bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, etc.) dans l’un des  marchés locaux de la ville de Cotonou. Isabelle, grâce à cette activité arrive à supporter une partie des charges de sa famille notamment la scolarisation des enfants. Isabelle avait bénéficié de crédit à ALIDé pour renforcer son activité et elle l'avait bien remboursé. Actuellement Isabelle sollicite un nouveau prêt à investir dans son activité pour mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Isabelle Johnson is 45 years old and married to Claude Tometissin. She and her husband have two children, both of whom attend school. She and her family live in Gbégamey, a working-class district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Isabelle makes a living selling cereals and sundries (candy, cookies, cartons of milk, canned goods such as sardines, tomatoes and sugar, pasta, laundry and dishwasher detergents, bathroom soap etc.) at a local market in Cotonou. Her business enables her to ensure that a portion of the family expenses is covered, her children’s school education in particular. Isabelle previously obtained a loan from ALIDÉ to develop her business and paid it back without issue. She is currently looking to obtain another loan to invest in her business to better meet customer demand. ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Fon, Benin’s regional language. Benin is a small West African country next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. ALIDÉ offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sundries (detergent, household soap, canned goods, toothpaste, toothbrushes, pasta and cereal grains: maize, beans, rice, millet, cassava flour.)

loans.name: Addo

texts.fr: Monsieur B. a pour activité la vente de services informatiques tels que le traitement de texte et la conception de logiciel.  Il a ouvert sa boutique qu’il a appelé « Copy Center » en 2008 à Agoe, un quartier au nord de Lomé, la capitale du Togo.  Voulant agrandir son commerce avec la vente de CD, clés USB et des fournitures de bureau pour  mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter 20 boîtes d’encre imprimante, 15 boîtes d’encre photocopie, 1 cartons de CD, 10 clés USB et d’autres matériels informatiques.
texts.en:
Addo sells computer services, such as word processing and software design. In 2008, he opened a shop that he calls the "Copy Center" in Agoe, just north of Togo's capital, Lomé. In order to better satisfy his customers, by expanding his business to include the sale of CDs, USB flash drives and some office supplies, Addo has requested his first loan from WAGES, which would permit him to purchase 20 cartridges of printer ink, 15 cartridges of photocopier toner, one case of CDs, and 10 USB flash drives, as well as other computer equipment.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of printer ink and and photocopier toner, CDs and various office supplies

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr: Massan a pour activité  la vente de céréales (sorgho, mil, maïs, etc.), un commerce qu’elle a commencé en 1993.  Voulant agrandir son stock pour mieux vendre et pour mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, elle sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter plus de céréales.elle est mariée à un maçon, et ils ont un enfant.  La famille habite à Agoe, une banlieue au nord de Lomé, la capitale du Togo.
texts.en:
Massan sells cereal grains (sorghum, millet and corn, etc.), a business that she began in 1993. Wanting to increase her inventory to improve sales and satisfy the customer demand, she has asked for her first loan in order to purchase more grain. Massan is married to a bricklayer, and they have one child. The family lives in Agoe, a suburb to the north of Lomé, the capital of Togo.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of maize, millet, sorghum and beans

loans.name: Tiguida

texts.fr: Tiguida D. est une femme de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle veut avec ce prêt maintenir et renforcer son activité de vente de pâte d’arachide. Avec ces revenus, elle compte assurer la dépense quotidienne à sa famille.
texts.en:
Tiguida D. is a 43-year-old woman, married and the mother of five children. She wants to use this loan to continue and expand her business selling peanut butter. With the income, she intends to meet her family's daily expenses.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Processing and sale of peanut butter

loans.name: Mashrafboy

texts.ru: Машрафбой занимается ремонтом и обслуживанием автомобилей различных марок. Его мастерская находится  в центре города, и постоянно имеет своих клиентов. Для того чтобы попасть к мастеру Машрафбою надо заранее за несколько дней записаться. Машрафбою 48 лет, он женат и имеет 4 детей. Жена нигде не работает и Машрафбой является единственным добытчиком в семье. Он собирается немного улучшить условия своего труда и приобрести для этого инструменты. Для этого ему необходимо 1500 сомони и собирается погасить этот займ  в течении 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mashrafboy repairs and services all brands of vehicles. His workshop is located in the center of town, and he always has clients. As there's a wait, one has to sign up several days in advance to get one's car worked on by him. Mashrafboy is 48 years old, married and has four children. His wife does not work outside the home and Mashrafboy is the family breadwinner. He plans to improve his working conditions to bit and to acquire some tools. To do so, he needs 1500 somoni and he plans to repay this loan within six months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquisition of tools

loans.name: Haby

texts.fr: Haby S. âgée de 45 ans est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle voudrait promouvoir son activité de vente de pâte d’arachide afin de mieux améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille.
texts.en:
Haby S. is 45 year old, married and the mother of six children. She would like to promote her peanut butter business in order to improve their living conditions, and the health and education of her family.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Processing and sale of peanut butter

loans.name: Minoutikpo

texts.fr: Minoutikpo a pour activité la vente de gravier roule.  pour bien exercer ce commerce Il a crée sa propre entreprise qu’il a appelé « Ets Thofils » en 2000 à Agoe, un quartier au nord de Lomé, la capitale du Togo.  Il a reçu  de ses clients des commandes qu’il ne peut satisfaire avec son stock de gravier actuel,  il sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter 10 bennes de gravier.Ce monsieur  est marié, et il a trois enfants, il vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’agoè Zongo
texts.en:
Minoutikpo sells river rock (gravel). To properly engage in this trade, he started his own business in 2000 in Agoe, a neighborhood north of Lomé, the capital of Togo. He named it "Ets Thofils," He has received orders from his customers that he cannot fill with the supply of river rock that he currently has on hand. He is asking for his first loan in order to purchase ten loads of rock. Minoutikpo is married and has three children. He lives with his family in the Zongo section of Agoe.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of river rock

loans.name: Tédè

texts.fr: Monsieur D. a pour activité la vente des ordinateurs et des matériaux informatiques.  Il a ouvert son boutique qui s’appelle « D. et Fils » en 1998 à Adidogomé, un quartier de Lomé, la capitale du Togo.  Voulant agrandir son commerce pour mieux vendre et mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit qui lui permettrai d’acheter 3 moniteurs, 2 unités centrales, 2 disques durs et 2 mémoires RAM.  Monsieur D. est marié et il a 4 enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. D. sells computers and computer accessories. He opened his shop that he calls « D. et Fils » in 1998 in Adidogomé, a district of Lomé, the capital of Togo. Wishing to expand his business to make more sales and better satisfy the needs of his clientele, he is asking WAGES for his first loan which will allow him to buy 3 monitors, 2 CPUs, 2 hard disks, and 2 RAM memories. Mr. D. is married and has 4 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of computer parts

loans.name: Hamady

texts.fr: Hamady B. est un jeune de 25ans habitant à kolda. Il est marié et pére d'un enfant. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille,il méne des activités commerciales. Ainsi chaque matin, il s'approvisionne, chez le fabricant, en laits caillé mis dans des sachets de 100 et de 200F CFA, et avec son vélo, il parcours la ville de kolda de long en large pour la revente. Cette activité lui permet d'avoir des revenus avec lesquelles il assure les fonctions de pére de famille. Ainsi il voudrait pouvoir élargir sa clientéle(boutiques, restaurants, alimentations) par ses propres moyens.
texts.en:
Hamady B., 25, lives in Kolda. He is married and the father of one child. To support his family, he is engaged in a small business. Every morning, he gets his daily supply from the person who prepares buttermilk in bags at 100 and 200 F CFA and, on his bicycle, he pedals up and down through the town of Kolda, re-selling the buttermilk. This business allows him to make enough money to function as the father of a family. Thus, he would like to expand his clientele (shops, restaurants, grocery stores) with his own means.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stocking and re-selling buttermilk in bags

loans.name: Juliette

texts.fr: Elle est restauratrice à la gare routiére de kolda. Ses services offerts sont le petit-déjeuner et le repas de midi seulement. Juliette S. est mariée et mére de deux enfants. Pour assurer un bon service à ses clients composés en majorité de chauffeurs etd'apprentis- chauffeurs, elle a embauché une aide-ménagére qu'elle paye 20 00F CFA le mois.Elle voudrait agrandir sa gargotte qui lui permet de satisfaire ses besoins sociaux et ceux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Juliette does catering at the bus station in Kolda. She only offers breakfast and lunch. Juliette S. is married and the mother of two children. In order to ensure good service for her customers, composed mainly of drivers and apprentice drivers, she has hired a helper whom she pays 2000 F CFA per month. She would like to expand her little cafe which allows her to support herself and her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: catering breakfast and lunch

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia operates a food vending business in her village. She sells snacks and different viands. Since it is summer, she also sells halo-halo which is in great demand during this season. She now wants to avail herself of a loan of 5000 PHP as additional capital for her small business. She hopes that it will make improvements for the benefit of her family. She is positive that by working hard, and with patience and faith in God, her business will be productive.

Ofelia has three children: Leanie (26-years-old, a homemaker), Ginalyn (23-years-old, a cashier in Batangas), and Mark Don (11-years-old, in grade school). They are presently residing in the rural village of Tandul in Cabatuan, Isabela and farming is their major source of income.

loans.use: Investment in food vending business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria A. has been operating a small community-based store for a year. She is 57 years old and married to Francisco. The couple lives peacefully and simply in the village of Tandul in Cabatuan, Isabela. Her husband works as a farmer and a tricycle (rickshaw) operator.

They have five children: Marilyn - 31 years old, married, and working as a domestic helper in Hong Kong; Margie - 29 years old, married; Mercy and Maricar - 24 years old and Jogi - 22 years old. All of them are high school graduates but they have been unable to pursue college education due to lack of finances.

Gloria wants to borrow 6000 PHP from the lenders as capital to make her business grow and to increase her income. She believes that hard work and patience are essential for business success.

loans.use: Investment in small store

loans.name: Marcely

texts.en:
Marcely has been managing a vegetable vending business for almost a year. She's planted different vegetables in her backyard, then sells to the public at harvest. Their main source of income is farming. Sometimes they also make tamarind candies for extra income.

At the moment, she is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to utilize for her vegetable business. She strives to be a good mother to her children, a good wife to her husband, and to become a successful businesswoman someday.

Marcely is doing her best to support her family and provide them with a better standard of living. Their children are: Rosielyn (29-years-old, a domestic helper); Ronnie (27-years-old, a farmer); Joker (25-years-old, a construction worker); and twins, Jeremy and Jerome (15-years-old, third year high school). They live in Barangay Tandul Cabatuan, Isabela.

loans.use: Investment in vegetable vending business

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita and Alfredo G. have been married for 11 years and they have not had a child because of a major operation that Perlita needed for an ovarian cyst. She and her husband have adopted a child. They are now living together at Barangay Tandul Cabatuan, Isabela. She has promised to treat this boy as her own child and send him to school to earn a college degree through God's grace.

She has been managing a small village store for a year and she is earning an average of 600 PHP a day. She saves some of it to use as rolling capital for her business. She hopes to borrow 5000 PHP to build a more concrete and safe stall for her store. Perlita is doing her best to increase her business capital and to sustain it, for the future of her adopted child and for the welfare of her whole family.

loans.use: Investment in small store

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is engaged in hog raising. Maintaining her business requires her to invest some capital in feed. To sustain her business, she wishes to borrow 5000 PHP. She works hand in hand with her husband to meet the needs of their family. She prays that somehow she will be successful in this venture. “It is through God that we can do more than what we can do in our lives”, says Celia.

Celia is happily married to Charlie and they have five children: Rodante – 36 years old and Benedict – 34 years old, they are both factory workers; Mary Jane – 32 years old, a domestic helper in Singapore; Mary Ann – 30 years old, a housewife and their youngest is Maribel – 27 years old. Celia and her husband are living together at Barangay Tandul in Cabatuan, Isabela.

loans.use: Investment in hog raising business

loans.name: Liany

texts.en:
“If you can’t have the best of what you want, learn to make the best of what you have” said Liany, a 26-year-old woman who is a sari-sari (community-based) store owner.  She is married to a farmer named Marlon. They have three children: Shine Prex who is 8 years old and studies at the elementary level, Charles Paul who is 5 years old, and Lemar who is 3 years old. The family is living happily in the rural village of Tandul in Cabatuan, Isabela. The couple strives to combat life's difficulties by doing well in their business.

Liany is a vegetable vendor and has been a store operator for one year.  She also aims to have a livestock business in the future in order to have another source of income to save and prepare for the education of their children.  She would like a loan that will serve as additional capital to expand her business. She wants to work hard for the future of her children.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia D. R. is 48 years old and married to Carlos. She and her husband were gifted with four children: Carmelita - 24 years old, an elementary school teacher; Allan - 23 years old, a bakeshop helper; Carla - 19 years old, second year college student and Carlos Jr. - 14 years old, high school sophomore student. They are residing in Barangay Tandul of Cabatuan, Isabela, a rural and well irrigated place where farming is the major source of income of the residents.

Hog raising is her chosen business. Every three months, Amelia can earn an average income of PHP 7,500 that she budgets to provide for their immediate needs and for the education of their children. She also uses some of the money as rolling capital for the maintenance of her business.

She now requests a loan of PHP 5,000 that she will use for further improvement of her enterprise. She hopes to fulfill all her dreams for her family, especially her children. She strongly believes that bringing out the best, and faith in God, would be of great help to achieve her dreams for her family.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is a young mother, 23 years old. Her husband, Elmer, is a furniture worker. They are blessed with a baby boy named Vincent who is four months old. At present, the couple are living with their parents and work hard to sustain their business so that someday they can have their own house.

After almost five years operating their furniture shop business, Vida plans to expand the business by means of a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP 5,000.

At the moment, the couple have two laborers in the shop. For extra income, Vida sometimes sells “lambanog” (locally made wine in Ilocos region) in their neighborhood. Since she loves selling, she hopes that her plan for expansion will come to reality so that she can help her husband and provide for the welfare of their children.

loans.use: To expand their furniture shop business

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia and David L. are blessed with five children: Wilson - 27 years old, a farmer; Wilma - 26 years old, a factory worker; Lilibeth - 24 years old, a housewife; Ronald - 20 years old, a rice-mill worker and Jomar - 16 years old, just graduated from high school and hoping to start his college education in June. They are living in Tadul Cabatuan, Isabela, a rural area. One of their sources of income is farming from which they harvest twice a year.

Leticia is a fruit and vegetable vendor in their village. With the help of her family, she was able to put up a backyard vegetable operation from which she personally sells. The business is already ten years old now and she wishes to make it grow. For this reason she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000.00 that she can use as business capital.

loans.use: To provide business capital

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
Roy A. is already a widower. His wife died eight years ago because of heart failure. He has five children: the twins Raymart and Raymond - 16 years old; Richard - 14 years old, a high school freshman student; Arcee - 9 years old, in grade school, and their youngest, Clifford - 7 years old, also in grade school. With the help of his older twin boys in managing their livelihood, Roy hopes to continue to send his three younger children to school. They live in the peaceful village of Tandul Cabatuan, Isabela.

Roy has managed a tricycle transport and welding business for about 20 years. The business has become their sole source of income supporting the needs of his family. He now wants to borrow PHP 5,000 that he can use as additional capital for his welding shop business. He believes that the loan would be of great help to his business and especially to the education of his children. He further said that “a man only lives once and should do what is right”.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for his welding business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
“Happiness does not come from doing easy work but from the afterglow of satisfaction”, says Evangeline.

Evangeline is 47 years old and happily married to Dante. Their marriage is blessed with three children: Mars - 23 years old, an Overseas Filipino Worker in Saudi Arabia; Glen - 21 years old, a laborer, and their youngest is Dante Jr. - 19 years old, works as an encoder in the market.

Evangeline has managed a hog-raising business for almost three years now. She is glad that she can generate an average of PHP 9,000 every four months. With her wish to expand her piggery, she is now requesting a loan of PHP 6,000. Aside from hog raising, her husband also operates a tricycle transport from which they get some of the financial support for the maintenance of their hogs. The loan she would like to borrow would be of help not only for her business needs but also for her family.

loans.use: To expand her piggery

loans.name: Merli Sulema

texts.es:
La Sra.Merli Sulema H., se dedica a la Elaboracion y venta de Tortillas desde hace diez años, actividad que realiza todos los dias de la semana, su horario de labores es de 6:00 AM hasta la 1:00 Mediodia, descansa un rato en la tarde y vuelve a comerzar a las 4:00 PM y termina  a las 7:00 PM, tiene clientes fijos ya que su tortillas son muy ricas y estan  elaboradas con maiz de 
color amarillo, La señora necesita un credito para terminar la contruccion del baño sanitario ya que el actual esta muy deteriorado. Con su negocio ha logrado ir mejorando su vivienda, ella tiene tres hijos los que estudian en la escuela, colegio y el mayor trabaja, su esposo es Albañil y el mismo realizara la contruccion del baño.
texts.en:
Ms. Merli Sulema H., has made, and sold, tortillas for a living since she was ten-years-old. She sells tortillas everyday. Her work schedule is from 6:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. She rests for a while in the afternoon and starts again at 4:00 p.m. She finishes at 7:00 p.m. She has regular clients because her tortillas are delicious and are made with yellow corn. She needs a loan in order to finish building a bathroom because her current one is in shambles. She has been able to fix up her house because of her business. She has three children. One goes to elementary school, one to high school and the eldest works. Her husband, Albañil, will build the bathroom.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar materiales para contruccion de Baño Sanitario

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Inoyat

texts.ru: Иноят занимается куплей продажей детской одежды и разных мелких товаров. Постоянного места торговли не имеет и ездит по разным дням по кишлакам, где проходят местные базары. Опыт в этой деятельности несколько лет, так как после потери постоянного места работы она была вынуждена заняться предпринимательством. Иноят недавно исполнилось 44 года, она замужем и воспитывает 4 детей. Старший сын по выходным дням помогает матери в ее торговле. Иноят подала заявку на КИВА, так как собирается немного обновить свой ассортимент с приходом весны.
texts.en:
Inoyat buys and sells children's clothing and various small items. She does not have a regular shop, but each day travels to a different small town where there's a local market. She has several years of experience in this line of work, because after losing her regular place of work, she was forced to go into business. Inoyat recently turned 44. She is married and is raising four children. Her oldest son helps his mother in her business on weekends. Inoyat applied to Kiva for a loan since she is planning to restock her inventory with an assortment for spring.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To restock inventory

loans.name: Brenda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Brenda V. tiene 23 años de edad y vive en el barrio victoria de san lorenzo, esta soltera y vive con su madre, ella estudia enfermeria y se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa y tarjetas para celular, inicio su negocio desde hace 1 año y necesita el prestamo para comprar de recargas, tarjetas y ropa por mayor. 

Su sueño es tener su negocio mas grande y graduarse de enfermera.
texts.en:
Brenda V. is 23 years old and lives in the Victoria neighborhood of San Lorenzo. She is single and lives with her mother. She studies nursing and is in the business of selling clothes and cards for mobile phones. She began her business a year ago and she needs a loan in order to buy rechargers, cards, and wholesale clothing.

Her dream is to have a bigger business and graduate from nursing school.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes and calling cards for mobile phones

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Abror

texts.ru: Аброр не имеет постоянной работы. Свой доход он имеет от выполнения разных работ и еще он занимается куплей продажей мелкого рогатого скота на местных рынках. Доход небольшой, но так как Аброр хорошо разбирается в этом, торговля скотом приносит стабильный доход. Аброру 32 года, женат и имеет 2 детей. Аброр собирается получить займ и пустить его в свой маленький бизнес.
texts.en:
Abror does not have regular employment. The income he has comes from completing a variety of odd jobs and, in addition, he buys and sells small-horned cattle at local markets. It is not a lot of money, but since Abror is well versed in it, the cattle trade brings in a stable income. Abror is 32 years old, married and has two children. He is planning to take out a loan and invest it in a small business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Diana Jeaneth

texts.es:
La joven Diana Jeaneth V. C. tiene 20 años de edad y vive en union libre con el señor Asael Eliu Sabillon Pineda con el han procreado un hijo que tiene dos años de edad.
ella es una persona muy emprendedora y dinamica se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosmeticos desde hace 1 año, le ha hido muy bien, ella vende la mercaderia en los barrios y colonias de san lorenzo,
su medio de tranporte para la venta de su mercaderia es en bicicleta.
necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia para semana santa y asi poder obtener mas utilidades y suplir los pedidos de sus clientes.
su pasatiempo favorito es jugar con su hijo y ademas desea comprarse una casa.
texts.en:
Diana Jeaneth V. C. is 20 years old and lives with her partner, Asael Eliu Sabillon Pineda, with whom she has a 2-year old son. She is a highly enterprising and dynamic individual who has successfully made a living over the last year selling clothes and cosmetics in the suburbs and districts of San Lorenzo. She carries her wares by bicycle. She needs the loan to buy more merchandise for Holy Week and in doing so increase her profits and better meet customer demand. Her favorite hobby is playing with her son and she would like to buy her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and cosmetics

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ruth Auxiliadora

texts.es: La Sra. Ruth O. vive en union libre con el Sr. Henry Colindres, ella tiene 33 años de edad, es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de tarjetas para recargas de llamadas para celulares, tambien vende productos de belleza por catalogo, ella tiene 3 hijos y todos estan estudiando, ella nos comenta que quiere que sus hijos se graduen de la universidad, para que sean hombres de bien, esa es la meta a largo plazo de ella, con las ventas de las tarjetas para celulares le va muy bien, pero necesita comprar mas de varias denominaciones ya que es un producto muy vendido y tiene que viajar para poder comprarlas, por eso quiere comprar una buena cantidad y asi tener en existencia y no estar viajando a cada rato para comprar este producto.
texts.en:
Ruth O. lives with her partner, Henry Colindres. She is 33 years old and a storekeeper selling prepaid mobile phone cards and mail-order beauty products. She has 3 sons, all of whom are studying, and tells us that it is her long-held wish for them to graduate from university and make honest men of themselves. Her prepaid phone cards sell very well, but she needs to buy more offering different prepaid amounts as she has to travel around to get hold of them. She wants to buy a large supply to always have plenty available and therefore avoid constantly travelling to replenish her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pre-paid mobile phone cards

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maura Lidia

texts.es:
la Sra. Maura G. tiene 35 años de edad y es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 18 años de edad que estudia en la universidad autonoma de Honduras, ella se dedica al negocio de venta de golosinas como ser: pastelitos, tacos, baleadas,pan con frijoles, tajaditas fritas de platano, pollo frito, pastelitos de carne de res y cerdo., ella tiene este negocio desde hace 10 años y gracias a el a podido salir adelante ella y su hija, necesita el credito para comprar los materiales con que hace sus golosinas.
el deseo mas grande de ella es poder graduar a su hija de la unversidad.
texts.en:
Maura G. is 35 years old and is a single mother with an 18 year old daughter who studies at the Autonomous University of Honduras. Maura works in her business of selling snacks such as: pastries, tacos, baleadas (Honduran tortillas filled with mashed, fried beans and other ingredients), bread with beans, fried sliced bananas, fried chicken, and pastelitos (pastries) of beef and pork. She has had this business for 10 years and thanks to it has been able to move ahead for herself and her daughter. She needs the loan to buy materials with which she makes the snacks. Her greatest desire is for her daughter to graduate from the university.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beef, port, and chicken, flour, oil, lard, vegetables, salt, spices, soft drinks, fire wood, beans, and bread.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Daniel Alfonzo

texts.es: El Sr. Daniel D. tiene 40 años de edad, el vive en union libre con la Sra. Gladys Marina Molina con la cual han procreado 2 hijos, uno de ellos esta en la escuela y el otro que es mayor le ayuda en la pesca, el compra curiles para venderlos ya que este tipo de mariscos se vende muy bien en esta zona, con los curiles se hace un buen ceviche y mucha gente lo compra porque tiene un sabor muy delicioso, el tiene 2 lanchas para pescar y en estos momentos el necesita el credito para comprarle un motor ya que se le daño el que tiene puesto, y esta es su herramienta de trabajo sin ella no puede sacar su producto del mar. por tal razon el esta solicitando el credito.
texts.en:
Daniel D. is 40 years old and lives with his partner, Gladys Marina Molina, with whom he has 2 sons. The younger son is at school and the elder helps him with fishing. He buys clams to sell them on, as this kind of shellfish sells very well around here. Clams can be used to make a fine ceviche (seafood salad marinated in lemon juice) and many people buy it for its delicious flavour. He has 2 fishing boats and now needs the loan to buy an engine, as his current one has broken down. He can't fish without this particular equipment, which is why he is requesting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fishing boat engine

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Milagros Areli

texts.es: la Joven Milagros S. tiene 22 años de edad, vive en union libre con el Joven Ronery Alvarez con el cual han procreado un hijo de 7 meses de edad, el trabaja como bombero de una gasolinera y ella se dedica a la venta de pescado blanco, ella necesita el credito para comprarse un termo o hielera mucho mas grande en donde ella pueda meter su producto, ya que el que tiene es muy pequeño y las ventas son buenas y no le alcanza para guardar todo su producto, el sueño de ella es poder comprarse su propia casa.
texts.en:
Milagros S. is 22. She lives with Ronery Alvarez, and they have a 7 month old son. He works as an employee at a gas station as a pump attendant, and she sells whitefish. She needs a loan to buy a bigger thermos or ice cooler where she can put her product. The one she now has is very small. Sales are good, but she does not have enough space to keep all of her fish. Her dream is to be able to buy her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy a larger cooler

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
la Sra. Blanca V. tiene 29 años de edad, vive en union libre con Marlo Rodas con quien tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos estudian en la escuela y el otro esta recien nacido, ella se dedica a la venta de lacteos y verduras desde hace 7 años, ella necesita el prestamo para la compra de quesillo, matequilla y verduras para suplir las necesidades de sus clientes, ella tiene que vender mas para tener mas ganancias ya que las necesita para poder darles todo a sus hijos, ahora todo esta bien caro para manter un hijo recien nacido y las ganancias que tiene en estos momentos no le ajustan para darles el sustento a sus hijos, 
su meta es poder comprar una casa. y que sus hijos sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Blanca V. is 29 years old and lives with her partner Marlo Rodas, with whom she has 3 children. Two of the children are at school and the other is a newborn baby. Blanca has been selling dairy products and vegetables for 7 years. She needs the loan to buy curd cheese, butter and vegetables to meet customer demand. She needs to sell more and bring in more money to ensure that her all of her children's needs are met, as taking care of a newborn baby proves very costly these days. Her current earnings are not enough to support her children properly. Her ambition is to buy a house and for her children to become good people in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dairy products and vegetables

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Sin N., 55, is a humble widower with five children, two married and living separately, the other three single and employed. One of Mr. N.'s daughters, Ms. Chanthu, 25, is a goldsmith and provides income to help support the family. The family lives in Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. 

Sin, a military policeman in the village, is requesting a loan to build a kitchen to make the family's cooking easier. This addition will significantly improve the family’s standard of living. 

Mr. N.'s daughter is shown in the picture.

loans.use: To build a kitchen.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mr. Mao S., 28, is married to Maly, 23 and they live in the rural area of Banteay Meanchey Province. The young couple reside with their two teenage children who are enrolled in the local public school.

They make a daily income by carving marble from the mountains, located far from their house. They sell to the buyers who come to purchase at their home. But the income is not enough for the family.

Mr. Mao S. would like an $800 loan in order to buy speakers, a generator and musical instruments. They will use them to generate more revenue. Mr. S.'s wife is pictured because he was not available.

loans.use: To buy a generator, speakers and musical instruments

loans.name: Mrs. Sath Prum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sath P. is the president of a village bank in Dei Edth Kaoh Phos village in Kandal province. There are ten people in her village bank. She is a pig breeder. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan.

Her husband, Mr. Sun Tork, owns a small business making rice wine to sell. This couple has four children, one of whom is a laborer while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase piglets

loans.name: Mrs. Sithoeun Dong Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Ten people living in Dei Edth Kaoh Phos village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Sithoeun D. is a 30 year-old village bank president. She is a beautician who has been hired by the people during weddings, birthdays, parties, and so on.

Since she has a lot of customers, she needs many cosmetics to support her business, thus she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Haem Vanthuon, is an electric repairer. Mrs. Sithoeun D. has three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the other is too young to work or stuD.. Mr. Vatana D. does not come to take a loan but his wife does, so she is presented in the picture instead him.

loans.use: Needs many cosmetics to support her business.

loans.name: Hou

texts.en:
Mrs. Hou C., 38, lives in a medium-sized wooden house in Banteay Meanchey Province with her other three family members and earns a living by selling Khmer noodles to nearby neighborhoods. Her husband, Rong, 39, drives a motor taxi and also has a job as a requirement worker. The couple can make a daily income of $6 and are very responsible to their two single children, providing food, clothing, and medical care. 

Rong’s motor taxi income is currently inconsistent due to frequent mechanical problems, so Hou is requesting a loan to buy a new motorcycle to replace it.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle to replace an old one broken.

loans.name: Mrs. Kosal Penh Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of fourteen members, is located in Chheu Teal village in Kandal province and they plan to use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Kosal P. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a fishwife.

Her husband, Mr. Khut Louch, is a fisherman who is saving the money to support his family. Although he tries to work hard he still earns less income to support his family living because he has few fishnets and others tools for his fishing. Thus, Mrs. Kosal P. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets and others tools for her husband’s fishing.

She is 40 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school. Mrs. Reth C. does not come to take a loan but her husband does, so he is presented in the picture instead her.

loans.use: To buy more fishnets and others tools for her husband’s fishing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Ms. S. is 49 years old and presently residing at Magsaysay, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed and blessed with two children - both are employed. Ms. S. is presently living with her mother-in-law. She is engaged in growing vegetables and corn as support to their income.

Ms. S. became a member of Paglaum in March 2001 followed by a sudden stoppage of membership when she tried an employment abroad. Now she’s requesting her 9th loan amounting to PHP 5,000. The loan is to be used as payment for labor in the preparation of land, for buying seedlings for the garden and for fertilizer.

Her hope and aspiration in life is to have an abundant harvest so that she can save for her future grandchildren.

loans.use: To pay for land preparation and to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Mrs. Teresita D., 36 years old, is married and lives at Tawi-tawi, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed with four children. Her husband is a fisherman.

The source of raw material that is commonly seen in their place is a nipa tree plantation. Her other source of income is from making nipa huts (the native house constructed out of bamboo with a thatched roof using nipa leaves). Just this March 2009, she obtained a loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and started to buy nipa. She was impressed by the programs and services that PMPC offers and that’s why she joined.

Now, she is applying for PHP 3,000 to buy additional nipa to be used on nipa huts. She will be fulfilled enough if she sees all her children obtain a comfortable life ahead.

loans.use: To buy nipa for making nipa huts

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
In the town of Tabo-o, Jimenez, lives a certain Mrs. Josephine C.. Having a mini "carenderia" (small restaurant) is really a big help for her. She is 38 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is an employee receiving only a minimum wage.

Considering the economic crisis we are facing today, Mrs. C. works very hard in order to survive. She cooks for her carenderia & cafeteria at the same time. Fortunately, the daily food needs of her family are free because of the business.

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative is a big help to her family and business. She has obtained loans several times. Now, she applies for PHP 10,000 to buy additional bread, coffee and meat for her business. She hopes that her business will be successful and will someday expand into a restaurant selling a variety of foods.

loans.use: To buy bread, coffee and meat for her carenderia

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a native of Tolon, Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte. She has three children. Since her husband is dead she has raised her children alone. Her main source of income comes from her sari-sari (grocery) store.

She's now on her 3rd loan cycle with a request for PHP 5,000 for the purchase of additional stock for her grocery store. She needs to buy other items that are not yet displayed but which are always asked for by her loyal customers. Aside from the income from her groceries, she is also involved in selling bananas.

She is always hoping that her business will grow big, so that she can send all her children to a college education. It is also her utmost desire to have a decent home someday.

She said that, for her, it is really a great privilege that she has become one of the members of Paglaum because of its various programs and services that she has already availed herself of.

loans.use: To purchase additional items for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.en:
Ricarda is involved in a whole nuts buying and selling business. She is positive that this business endeavor will give a good return since copra buying is currently stable. She is also engaged in selling okay-okay (used clothes from other nations).

Ricarda is living in Baliangao, Mis. Occ. She is already a widow and all her children are married. She was recognized as a Coop member in September 2002. She is a member in good standing. She is now on her 12th loan cycle and presently requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP for additional business capital.

She hopes that her present businesses become stable so that she can set aside enough savings for her old age, just as she is doing now.

loans.use: To buy whole coconuts for sale

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Rubelyn V. is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old and is married with two children. Her husband is an auto mechanic.

Due to financial difficulty, she decided to engage in a sari-sari store to assist in meeting their daily basic needs. She started with minimal capital. A relative shared information with her about the programs and services provided by Paglaum MPC, and she decided to become a full-pledged member last November (2008), which allowed her to get a loan amounting to six thousand pesos as additional capital. She reports that it has helped a lot in providing for their necessities.

She dreams someday that the business will expand: she would like to build a bigger, concrete store, send their children to school, and live life at a higher standard of living.

loans.use: Additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Regie

texts.en:
Mrs. Regie J. is 25 years old, married, and blessed with one child. Her husband is presently working as a gas station attendant. She is also operating a sari-sari store from their residence. She started the business from the capital given to her parents. Her mother, already a member at the Co-op, had encouraged her daughter to join Paglaum in order to obtain additional capital for the business, as well as because of some of the benefits it provides, particularly insurance.

Mrs. J. received Php 5,000.00 as her first loan. She used the money to buy additional grocery items, such as assorted canned goods, bath and laundry soap, seasonings, and beverages.

She’s hoping that someday her business will expand and become a mini grocery, that all of her future kids can finish school, and that she can build a concrete house for the family.

loans.use: Buying additional grocery items for the store

loans.name: Twaiba

texts.en:
Twaiba has been a tailor in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She currently earns a very small monthly profit and works at her business for 12 hours.

She belongs to Hatutaki majungu group loan and is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more tailoring items (clothes, needles, and white flour) for her duties. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Twaiba is 18 years old and she is married.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, needles, and white flour for her business.

loans.name: Tujikomboe Group

texts.en:
Chumu has sold food (snacks and soup) in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 3 years. She works 12 hours a day at her business, earning an average monthly profit of $42.  


She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more  food items (flour and cooking oil) and kerosene for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, she will be able to grow her business and that her profit will increase, so that she may save money for the future.  


Chumu is 25 years old, and she is married. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Mtumwa, Pili and Mariam. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar

loans.use: To buy more flour, cooking oil and kerosene for her business.

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.en:
Mrs. Celedonia A., 51 years old, is married with 8 children.  She lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.  Her husband is a government employee.  

The couple has strived hard for the family.  Because of their sewing skills, they decided to venture into the tailoring business, but they did not have access to capital.  With determination and courage, Mrs. A. applied for membership at Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, and borrowed Php 10,000 through the cooperative.

The small business is going so well that Mrs. A. has decided to expand it.  She is seeking $425 to purchase an additional sewing machine.  Mrs. A. paid her previous loan in a timely fashion, and is a member in good standing of the cooperative.  She has high hopes that God will bless her business.  Mrs. A. and her family hope to set up their own tailoring shop in the city when their profits allow.  In the future, she wants to see all her children finish their studies, and to renovate her family's home.

loans.use: Purchase additional sewing machine

loans.name: Esteria

texts.en:
Mrs. Esteria A. is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental and is 47 years old.  She is married with 7 children:   3 of them are married, 1 is working at Cebu City as an office clerk and the others are still in school.

Mrs. A.'s husband is a chief cook on a ship. Their life is not as complicated as other people's, in terms of finances. Mrs. A. decided that in addition to taking care of her children, she would start a hog-raising business. She took out a loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in November 2007 to purchase piglets and feed. Mrs. A. and her husband hope to witness the success of their children as fruits of their endeavors.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed

loans.name: Poshi

texts.en:
Poshi has owned a small beauty salon in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 1 year. She belongs to tuwe wakweli group loan (Group code 2101).  She works at her business 12 hours a day and currently earns an average monthly profit of $225. 


She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy a hair dryer and other items for her salon. She is hoping that through this loan, she will be able to grow her business and her profit will increase so that she can pay school fees for her children and save money for future use.  


Poshi is married, and has two children, ages 18 and 4. She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer and other items for her business.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Mrs. Marissa F. is 28 years old and married with 1 child. She lives in Nazareth, Buenavista, Pagadian City. In order to earn a living she takes in and raises pigs. In order to earn more money, she decided to sell hogs to the market. 

Through Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC), she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy additional feed and expand her hog-raising business. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig pen to provide more sanitary conditions. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and will benefit her family, supplementing her husband's income. She dreams of a good education for her child.

loans.use: expand her hog-raising business

loans.name: Maisha Bora Group

texts.en:
Zalbia has been selling food  (soup, chicken and porridge) in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 3 months. She works for 12 hours every day, and currently earns an average monthly profit of $185.


She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business.  She also wants to begin selling clothes. She is hoping that through this loan, she will be able to grow her business, so that her profit will increase and  she can improve her home and pay school fees for her children.  


Zalbia is 28 years old, married, and has three children: ages 9, 5 and 1. She also cares for one additional dependent. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Bimkubwa and Maua, who also have their own small businesses in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Tes' Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tes V. has been selected to be the leader by the other three members in the group loan; all the members are people living in Battambang Province.

V., age 59, earns a living by selling breakfast foods in her home. Most of her clients are villagers who live near her house. She is a widowed mother who has three children who are married. One of her sons still lives in the family home and helps to support the family by selling car wheels. V. would like a loan for her son to use as capital to buy additional wheels for sale.

The other three borrowers are:

S. is a widowed woman selling ice blocks in her home and she requests a loan to buy a used motorbike to transport fish for sale.

V. is a grocery seller, applying for a loan to increase her stock of grocery items.

L. sells fresh fish in the market and she is requesting a loan to order more fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy additional wheels for her son's business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa M. is from Buenavista, Pagadian City and has two children. She is married to a businessman and they work together at a hog-buying and hog-raising business. She and her husband manage their little business, which they started from a small capital. Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing.

She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to PHP 7,000 for the expansion of their hog-raising business. As much as possible, they have to have all the needed capital to maximize the return. She wants to buy the pigs so she can resell them at the market, where they will fetch higher prices.

In the future, she dreams of saving from the daily sales and wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: To expand her hog-raising business

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 35 years old, married, and has four children: ages 16, 12, 10 and 8. She also cares for two additional dependents.

Salma has been a bites (maandazi: bread-like rolls) seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She belongs to Uvumilivu group loan (Group code 2101). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $80. Every day she works for 12 hours at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for her business and she wishes to start a new business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business and to open a new business

loans.name: Nanie

texts.en:
Mrs. Nanie S. is engaged in firewood vending to earn a living. Bundles of firewood are displayed along the road. Her customers are the passersby, local residents and carenderias (restaurants).

Mrs. S. is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 64-years-old and separated with three married children. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC since January, 2005, and is requesting a loan for additional capital and to build a shed for the firewood.

Mrs. S.’s heart's desire is to have a decent life with money for her old age and to be able to help send her grandchildren to school.

loans.use: Additional capital for a firewood business

loans.name: Mwamvita

texts.en:
Mwamvita has been a clothes (khanga) seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for four years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $60 and works at her business for 12 hours daily.

A member of the Ujamaa group loan, she is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more khanga for her resale. She is hoping to increase her profit and grow her business through this loan.

Mwamvita is 30 years old, is married, and has a five-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more khanga for resale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Mrs. Josephine A. is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old and is married with five children, three of whom live on their own while the younger two are schoolchildren still living at home. Her husband is working in a "bansohan" (a sewing mill), but the compensation he earns is not enough to support the family. She has therefore decided to raise hogs while at home taking care of the children. She received a loan from Paglaum MPC last July (2008) and used it to purchase hog feeds.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Mrs. Loreta A. is 45 years old, is married, and is a resident of Punta Sulong Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She has four children. The couple engage in fishpond fishing as their source of income.

She was one of the active members of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative under the micro-finance program called PDP-LP at their Barangay. She was recognized by the co-op in July 2005 and has availed herself six times of the credit service offered by the program. Now she has applied for an amount of Php 14,900.00, to be used to pay for labor in repairing and cultivating an extension of the fishpond.

Before Loreta became a member of Paglaum, her family suffered financially. Their only source of living comes from fishing, and earnings are unpredictable because they use only a fishing net. After having accessed the credit services as a Paglaum member, Loreta reports significant financial improvements in her family’s well-being. She is grateful for the help she has received from Paglaum because it has contributed so much to her family.

The couple is hoping that they will always experience a good and abundant harvest and that all of their children can eventually finish a college course.

loans.use: Repair and extension of fishpond.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosemary A. is a resident of Pta. Sulong, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental.  She’s 45 years old and married, with 5 children.  All of her children are married, too. 

Mrs. A. and her husband have managed fish cages as their main source of income since they were married. 	Mrs. A. is seeking financial support to repair her existing fish cages and extend her business. One of the members of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) in her barangay, or village, invited her to join the cooperative.  She sat in on the weekly meeting and asked for more information about the benefits of membership. 


Mrs. A. joined Paglaum on February 28, 2005.  She has used the cooperative's credit services 5 times.  This is her sixth request, for Php 14,800.00. She intends to use the loan for materials and labor to repair her existing fish cages. Mrs. A. and her husband are happy to be part of the Paglaum family, which offers services and products that help those in need.

loans.use: Repair fish cages

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki has been a fish seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar for 3 years. She belongs to Safi nia group loan (Group code 2007).  Every day she works at her business for 12 hours, earning an average monthly profit of $70. 

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fish, wheat flour and sugar for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, she will be able to grow her business and her profit will increase.   


Riziki is 33 years old, married, and has two children, ages 13 and 12.

loans.use: To buy more fish, wheat flour and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Мuхаbbат

texts.ru: Мухаббат молодая женщина, 38 лет, замужем и имеет 2 детей. Не имеет постоянной работы и посоветовавшись с мужем она решила заняться предпринимательством. Рассчитав различные виды бизнеса остановилась на продаже продуктов питания. Если даже все виды бизнеса имеют некоторый упадок в связи с экономическим кризисом, продукты питания все равно приносят прибыль. Мухаббат арендует прилавок в  2 метра и ассортимент товаров включает в себя различные виды макарон, чая, конфет, сахар и тп. У Мухаббат дружелюбная улыбка и поэтому у ее прилавка постоянно людно. Мухаббат и МикроИнвест сотрудничают уже больше года. Недавно Мухаббат подала заявку на новый займ и хочет приобрести оптом макароны и сахар.
texts.en:
Muxabbat is a young woman, 38 years old, married and has two children. She does not have regular employment, and after talking it over with her husband, decided to open a business. After considering various kinds of business, she settled on selling groceries. Despite the fact that all sorts of businesses have hit a low in the economic crisis, food still makes a profit. Muxabbat rents a 2-meter stall and her inventory includes various kinds of pasta, tea, candy, sugar and such. She has a friendly smile and because of it her stall is constantly busy. Muxabbat and MicroInvest have collaborated for several years. Recently Muxabbat applied for a new loan and she wants to purchase pasta and sugar in bulk.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bulk purchase of pasta and sugar

loans.name: Niza

texts.en:
Mrs. Niza A. is 58 years old and a resident of Punta Sulong, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental.  Her husband,  Alfredo, is a fisherman. The couple is blessed with 5 children. 


Niza and her husband started this business last year, buying and selling seashells and sea cucumbers.  Niza is one of the founding members of Jackfruit 2 Center in Punta Sulong, Baliangao, and continues to be a member in good standing.  She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative's micro-finance program in April 2004, and has used the credit services offered by the program 14 times. This loan request is her fifteenth, for Php 14,900.00 to expand her existing business. 


For Niza and her husband, Paglaum has contributed to her family's success.  Three of her children have finished their courses as a result of Paglaum's support for tuition fees.  With this loan,  the couple wishes to expand their business so that their other two children can also finish their college degrees.  Niza adds that while she is still a member of the Paglaum cooperative, she will do her part as a member so that she can have the opportunity to use its programs and services to support her family's dreams of educating their children.

loans.use: Expand buying and selling of seashells

loans.name: Subira Huvuta Kheri Group

texts.en:
For the last year, Maryam has made a living selling fish and chicken in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She  earns an average monthly profit of $90, and works at her business for 12 hours a day.  

Maryam is applying for her first loan from BRAC Tanzania and plans to use it to buy more fish and chicken to sell to her customers. She is hoping that this loan will help her increase her income and grow her business.  

Maryam is 25 years old, married, and has three children ages 8, 5 and 3. She will be sharing this loan with the two other members of her loan group, Mkasi and Ukuli. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar

loans.use: To buy more fish and chicken to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Josebel

texts.en: Mrs. Josebel T. is 43 years old, married and lives in Tawi-Tawi, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She has five children and her husband works as a cab driver. The family's other source of income is Video-5 (a machine that people rent to play songs). Mrs. Josebel T. was able to buy her Video-5 machine with help from the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She joined the co-op in July, 2008, and has already taken out and repaid several loans. She is applying for a new loan to repair and repaint the motorcycle which her husband uses at work. She also plans to buy another motorcycle in the near future. She hopes that by increasing her income, she will be able to have all of her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to repair and repaint a motorcycle.
